newsitem.title: USA: National Surgery offering declared effective.
newsitem.headline: National Surgery offering declared effective.

text.p: National Surgery Centers Inc said Tuesday a registration statement for an offering of 2,750,000 common shares at $24.25 a share was declared effective by the Securities and Exchange Commission.

The company is offering 2,003,011 of the shares, and the balance is being offered by certain selling stockholders. None of the shares involved in the offering are being sold by the company's management.

Managing underwriters for the offering are Alex. Brown & Sons Inc, Furman Selz Inc and J.P. Morgan Securities Inc. The Company has granted its underwriters an over-allotment option to purchase up to an additional 412,500 common shares within 30 days of the offering.

National Surgery said it will use the net proceeds of the offering to repay certain indebtedness totaling approximately $10 million, with interest rates ranging from 7.5 percent to 13.4 percent annually.
The remaining net proceeds will be used for general corporate purposes, which may include future acquisitions and the development of surgery centers.
National Surgery Centers operates a network of 30 freestanding ambulatory surgery centers located in 13 states.
